Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Supnurse
Reviews.Content: Arrived for Bike Week...cost expensive $200 night jacked up for sure! Room smelled musty, opening slider helped. Indoor pool closed early by 10 pm it's not like they have guard?? Also, Atrium bar closed early according to desk staff it's because people complained about noise! Really at $200 a night for low budget room we should get something. Room keys kept deactivating-annoying the guy who came up to room rude & abrupt! Really? We will definitely look elsewhere next year

Reviews.Title: “This is probably a great hotel at the beginning of the season, but by September, it's just worn out.”
Reviews.Author: Christani
Reviews.Content: Our intro was our door which would not open. A grumpy fix it guy came and showed us how we first had to run our key card, then give it a slam, then run key again and full body slam it open. He didn't seem to think this unusual. We figured no one could break in, but come on! As a smaller hotel, the beach wasn't crowded, and was very clean. Just worn out.

Reviews.Title: “Great views of the beach; noisy birds wake you up!”
Reviews.Author: SwannTraveller
Reviews.Content: We spent Easter weekend at the Quality Inn Oceanfront. We got a relatively cheap room and were travelling with two friends. We were pleasantly surprised to find our two-queen room had a mini kitchen with cutlery, plates, microwave, etc. as well as a lounge area. We spent our first night out on the balcony, overlooking the ocean and relaxing. The beds were older and sunken in the middle, so not the most comfortable sleeping arrangement. The hotel has a great atrium with a pool and two hot tubs (which were filled with shreiking kids), as well as a number of parrots. Early in the morning, we woke to what sounded like a teradactyl! It waws actually an Amazon Parrot but the screeches got us up very early. My advice: bring earplugs to sleep in! A great hotel with a great location, and would stay here again if we could get an oceanfront room on an upper level.

Reviews.Title: “No Quality Inn”
Reviews.Author: marc d
Reviews.Content: Quality is in the name only. Old everything, AC could not be controlled, bugs, hallways dirty, had to ask for bath towels everyday. Did not get dish washing cleaner that was ask for. Would never go back . This hotel needs major help>>>>Location is good and that is it

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay on the beach”
Reviews.Author: welltraveled_9
Reviews.Content: Recently went for a long weekend here and found it to be a good place to stay. Rooms were clean and the front desk staff on check in helpful. Ample parking and a 10% food discount offered for food at the Inn. It had exoctic birds in the lobby with fish and a pond. Indoor swimming pool and sauna. Good location for kids to stay as it also has an indoor pool for those rainy days. Has excellant access to the beach and is a well maintained property. I would stay there again if i would return to this area.

Reviews.Title: “Found bugs and mouse droppings in cabinets...”
Reviews.Author: Shadell
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Quality Inn, August 2012, for the amount of money they required it was the absolute WORSE HOTEL U HAVE EVER STAYED IN... I had to be moved iff site at another place. I was moved several times and all the rooms were old and had dead bugs and mouse droppings in the cabinets. Would never stay there again...

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, typical shore hotel”
Reviews.Author: SLaurenH
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a few nights in August. Hotel was completely booked. Arrived late at night and was able to find a parking space, so I'll rate the parking as good. We booked an Oceanfront room and I loved the view and waking up to the sound and sights of the ocean. Room to me is your typical "shore" room. Double beds with small kitchen and pull out couch, not dirty, but not overly clean. Bathroom was basic, water pressure was awful, could hardly wash the soap out of my hair. Like others said, there was mold in the bathroom and on the ceiling in the room. I feel this was due to the fact that while the air conditioning blew cold air, it did not effectively remove the humidity from the air, and everything in our room was "wet". Forget about blow drying your hair! The rooms seemed to be well insulated, I did not hear much noise from anyone, except them sliding the door open and closed at 3 am at least 20 times. Balcony also very private, with cement from floor to ceiling on both sides so your neighbors could not see you. I actually really liked that. Gave plenty of toiletries and towels. Rooms on ground floor have stairs leading to beach, which I thought was nice, but the sand dunes blocked the ocean view. Might be good if you had kids and something to keep in mind.. Place had two pools, one inside, one outside, and two hot tubs inside. I didnt use either of them because Im not a big fan of public pools, and they were overrun with kids. I was impressed however, it seemed that they drained the hot tubs and refilled them at least every other day. Thought that was good for germ control. As big as the hotel was, we actually couldnt find the check in desk at first! Its buried in the middle of everything and really small, but they do have great fresh fruit at the front desk every morning! Atrium is nice with tropical birds, computer area, pool, hot tubs, koi pond and snack bar that had great frozen drinks! Only thing I didnt like, but that you cant really avoid, is the strong chlorine odor in the entire atrium, hits you like a ton of bricks when stepping out of your room. And yes, on some days, the birds were pretty loud and fiesty, and did wake me up, but honestly, they were more of a pleasure to hear than peoples screaming kids in the morning that drowned out the birds. Thought location was good, we stayed here so we could walk to Seacrets. Also, not too far from the boardwalk, but not walkable. Hotel is in busier part of town. Basically, you pay a rediculous amount of money for a basic room, but to me, that is the shore in the summer. They tried to keep the place clean, but you will have a constant flow of wet, sandy people in and out all day, so I think they did a decent job. This was a quick getaway, so I knew I would pay through the nose, and we did have fun. But for the same price I can go to the Carribbean, all inclusive 5 star resort with airfare, which is what I normally do. We had a good time and needed a quick getaway and thats what we got. We may try this hotlel for the car show weekend next May. Good Luck.

Reviews.Title: “Our 10th time here, it may be time to start looking elsewhere.”
Reviews.Author: squrt43
Reviews.Content: Location is everything. That's what brought us to the place back in 2007. It's located beach front, close to local clubs, and mid island so it's a close bus trip to anywhere. Upon checking into our room, we could smell mold in the bathroom between the sink and bathtub. We looked but it appeared clean, just stunk pretty bad if you stood in that area. The heat lamp bulb was burnt out in the bathroom and the housing for the lamp was hanging from the ceiling. The refrigerator also had loud knocking sound inside the freezer. It would keep you awake so I opened the freezer and smacked the back wall of it and it eventually stopped. I would have requested a new room had we been spending longer than te weekend but they were advertising 100% occupancy so I don't know if relocating us would have even been possible. Other than that the room was unremarkable. It appears the entire outside of the hotel was painted in 2012. While the outside appears nice, the interior of the rooms are beginning to show their age from their upgrades from a couple years back. Staff if always very friendly. The highlight of this place is the Atrium. Food and drink in the Atrium is great, staff is great. This place is expensive, $950 for Fri/Sat/Sun. Yes I know you pay for location but I may look elsewhere and find something a little more for my money, and just come back and visit the Atrium.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, but not excellent.”
Reviews.Author: Ksena M
Reviews.Content: My husband had to work in this area so I reaped the benefits and we spent a week here. The hotel is definitely right on the beach and close to restaraunts, etc. The hotel was not the cleanest, but I'm not horribly picky, so I was ok. I've read complaints about the birds being too loud and waking people up, we had an atrium room and did not experience any problems. We were fortunate enough to be upgraded to a room with a kitchenette. This was great!! A full sz fridge, microwave, stove, and dishwasher were awesome! We traveled to the food lion and got much cheaper groceries than the CVS, which is close. A good thing to know, you can spend $3, or something like that, and get a bus pass which allows you to travel up and down the "strip" unlimited times...I think there are multi day passes as well. Now, my NEGATIVE....the fitness center! They should be considered false advertisement to say this Quality Inn even has one! There is a treadmill, bike, and stairclimber, but there are weightlifting machines that are broken just sitting there. Pathetic! Overall, the good outweighed the bad, but one of the reasons we booked was for a fitness center and to say the least, it was a huge letdown!

Reviews.Title: “nice mid week stay”
Reviews.Author: mothergoosed
Reviews.Content: I was had reservations about my reservation. Wasn't sure if the Quality Inn, was Quality. My daughters and I were pleasantly surprised. We had an Ocean front room with two double beds as requested. The room was a decent size, with decent furniture and was clean. The front desk people were very pleasant and very accommodating. I felt they were truly interested in their guests enjoying their stay. A top notch hotel, this is not. But if you want a decent, clean room on the ocean...this is the place for you. One side note, would not recommend booking with Expedia, better off calling the hotel yourself (you'll most likely get a better price).

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay!”
Reviews.Author: Jackie824
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Quality Inn Oceanfront and it was very enjoyable. First in 2010 and the second this past weekend. For both stays, we had an oceanfront king room. In 2010, there had been a recent storm which brought with it a swarm of little flies (maybe sand fleas?) which invaded our balcony. A call to the front desk brought the housekeeper to the room with a can of bug spray. She sprayed the heck out of the balcony and left the can for us if we needed it later. It helped a bit but then our balcony was covered in dead bugs. Needless to say, we didn't get much use out of the balcony for that trip. Luckily, we didn't have that problem this year. We had a AAA rate, but it was still a bit pricey for a Quality Inn. When we checked in this time around, we were given a 10% off coupon for the restaurant since we had stayed there before. Unfortunately, we didn't get a chance to use it. For both stays, our rooms were clean and comfortable but they could use a little updating. TV is not a flat screen but hopefully they'll update those soon. The bathroom was clean but was showing a bit of wear. The shower had a lot of small shelves for our toiletries which was good, but the water pressure wasn't very strong. Towels were soft and clean. We thought the AC was broken but it turned out the balcony doors (screen and glass) had sensors on them that would turn off the AC if the doors were open...great energy saving feature. We had a great oceanfront king for both stays and the view was fantastic! The bed was comfortable but it would have been nice to have a pillow top or memory foam layer. A big plus was the low noise level. A lot of hotels seem to have thin walls where you can hear your neighbor's conversation but we were pleased that we couldn't hear anything from our neighbors. The only noise complaint would be the birds in the atrium that would "wake up" way to early for us in the morning. It didn't last long though so we were able to fall back to sleep. The indoor pool was clean and heated...the hot tub was REALLY hot, couldn't stay in there too long. All in all, it was a great stay, both times. We'd definitely stay again and recommend to friends!

Reviews.Title: “Always wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: travelwithbaby27
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a long weekend just after July 4th. We stay here every year, and every year it is fabulous. The staff, especially Dan the manager, Dan the bartender, Simon, Drew, and Jim make you feel at home. The rooms are clean and beach access is so convenient. The pool is just perfect. We wouldn't think about staying anywhere else in Ocean City.

Reviews.Title: “Not what we expected”
Reviews.Author: ngbb1003
Reviews.Content: Looking at the photo's on their website, then opening the door of our romm...it was not what we expected. The walls, furniture, bathroom all needed updating badly. The bathroom vent did not work leaving the bathroom humid for a long time. The door mirror was chipped and needed to be replaced. Mirrors in both bathroom and bedroom were dirty and greasy, the closet door was off its track and almost fell, even the balcony door was somewhat of its track making it hard to open and close. TV was old. The ceiling in the bathroom had dirt or somethig black between the tiles. The pool had tiles missing. Overall the room itself was too bad for me to come back again. Maybe we were given the worst room in the hotel, after most of the reviews I read seemed to be very good and excellent. The week we booked was the most expensive, so I thought we would have a somewhat room that looked like the photos on the web. On the plus side, the food from the restaurant was very good. Service at the restaurant and front desk was excellent. We needed more towels and it only took minutes for them to bring them to our room. The TV went out, again someone was there to bring a replacement. Downstairs, the indoor pool and hot tubs were nice. The Atrim was nice. The bedding was clean and comfortable. Still I will not recommend this hotel to someone I know.

Reviews.Title: “Great management makes the difference!”
Reviews.Author: Thsamih
Reviews.Content: Small touches from management goes a long way! Very customer friendly and great for families with kids. The free coffee & tea 24x7, the birds and daily clown show for kids are nice. The hotel needs serious cleaning to fight some Mildew in some areas. I will go back again

Reviews.Title: “Fine vacation spot”
Reviews.Author: SarahWZ
Reviews.Content: My husband, my 12-year-old son, and I stayed there during July, 2012. It is a fine vacation spot. The building is not young but has been well maintained. The furniture is is working order, although very uninteresting. The kitchenette is old enough to have a stove instead of just a microwave. The sheets on the bed were new and of good quality, but the springs on the mattress were completely shot. The towels were serviceable but of low quality. The atrium has parrots, the largest and most beautiful carp I have ever seen, and turtles. Kids (and young-at-heart adults) loved it. Unfortunately, the indoor pool is also in the atrium so that everything has that indoor pool smell. There are kids everywhere and the atrium is very noisy. There is a nice size outdoor pool with a deep end deep enough for swimming but not for diving. The hotel is on the beach but far from the boardwalk. It is near, however, a large Dumster's restaurant and a delicious Thai restaurant (Satellite cafe). They provide lots of free fresh fruit in the entrance area and very high quality coffee 24/7 free near the elevator. The staff were friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: ticky v
Reviews.Content: I took my husband and 2 teenage boys for a long weekend. After reading the reviews, I didn't know what to expect. I do agree that the hotel is a little beaten up, but it was clean. New wallpaper and fresh paint should help that. Awesome location, with guarded beach. Nice pools and the atrium was neat with the birds and fish. Staff was very friendly, helpful and willing to make the stay the best. It had lots of parking and .was close to shops, restaurants and short drive to boardwalk. Would stay there again with the kids.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the price paid”
Reviews.Author: travelmomgaff
Reviews.Content: I brought my children here for probably the last family trip we'll take since the kids are getting older. We went here about 3 years ago and we loved it. Apparently, 3 years makes a huge impact on things. It def was not as clean as it was 3 years ago. I found multiple things under our beds. Really? You can't clean under the beds? There was a huge hole in our bathroom wall where the tissue box was supposed to be. They just kind of set the tissue box in the hole. This place was pretty disgusting. I had to wash every dish we tried to use prior to using it when we arrived. The toaster was gross and had to be cleaned out too. To top it off, the housekeeper took my youngest's pillow from home. I went down to the front desk to ask about it and was told sorry they will look for it and that was about it. Didn't even offer to replace it and never heard about it again. For the price I paid I expected a little more cleanliness. The plus side of the Quality Inn was that the Atrium Cafe was great about giving us things we may have forgotten for when we made dinner in the room. I don't think I would stay here again after this experience. If I'm going to pay that much it's going to be a little nicer that this.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel, great value”
Reviews.Author: David T
Reviews.Content: The three things I look for when I stay at a hotel are: Is the hotel clean? Definitely Are the beds comfortable? Definitely Is the location good? Definitely All of the above were met and there were several other positives. We arrived some 5 hours before check-in(we're on our 14 month olds schedule) and asked if we could check-in. The very friendly receptionist said the rooms weren't ready but took my cell phone number and told me he'd call as soon as my room was available. It was less than a half hour when he called back saying my room was ready...great customer service. The atrium was a neat feature, as was the pool bar. Our oceanfront room was spacious and had a nice kitchenette. We will definitely stay here on our next visit to OC!

Reviews.Title: “Had good pluses, but dirty bathroom”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer P
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night after 4th of July. Pros about this hotel are that its directly ocean front, walk out the front of the hotel and a few steps later youre at the beach. The hotel also had a ton of free parking, 2 pools, and 2 hot tubs. Our room faced into the atrium which wasnt bad, no ocean front view but kind of nice. It wasnt noisy until the parrots in the atrium started squwaking in the morning, which woke me up. I had 2 major cons. My first major con was the bathroom. It was dirty and run down. And the things that needed to be cleaned or fixed were relatively minor, but the combination of them was gross. With about an hours worth of work they could all have been taken care of, so in my mind they shouldve been. My 2nd major con was that we had a double bed, not a queen. Seriously? What hotel does this? I mean there was plenty of room in our room for a queen. And how much more is a queen than a double? Nominal. Spend the extra $. We had a night time in OC for our short trip, and the hotel wasnt terrible.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, wonderful Amenities!”
Reviews.Author: SpANG1
Reviews.Content: Having read the reviews of this hotel before we booked, I really only thought it would be average. Looking back on the reviews, I see that most of the negative ones are from 2010 and older. This leads me to believe this particular hotel made some serious improvements over the past few years, because I was pleasantly surprised! Our experience was very enjoyable! First of all, Quality Inn Oceanfront has a GREAT location. Not too far from the board walk (this should not be confused with the Quality Inn ON the boardwalk), but not so close that you see light up signs, hear people at all hours, and smell fast food everywhere. It's kind of right on the outskirts of things, much like the higher-end hotels. We had a 5th floor ocean view room and the view was fantastic! I woke up just about every morning to see the sunrise from the balcony. The beach is right behind the hotel and was very convenient to walk to. The hotel amenities were well-above average. An indoor pool with 2 hot tub areas and a sauna. An outdoor pool. Towels provided, too. They have a fun playground with a pirate ship AND a castle! Even a BBQ area. When we weren't at the beach, we were at a pool! The inside of the hotel (near the pool) features an 'Atrium' with actual tropical birds, a koi pond, and turtles. It's a very nicely laid-out area! The front desk ALWAYS has a supply of fresh fruit on hand. The room itself also had a lot of great comforts. There were 5 of us (2 adults, 3 kids) and there was PLENTY of space for us. 2 Full beds and a pull out couch (with mattress protectors) worked fine for all of us. It even had a privacy curtain which separated the room. Other nice stuff included a small kitchenette with FULL SIZE fridge, stove, microwave, deep-well sink, cupboard space, and even cooking utensils! A safe and a a 'charlie bar' to lock the sliding door for added security. It had free wi-fi, which was a little slow but they also had a computer room/area in case you needed it, which was nice! Laundry service is also INCLUDED (you just need to get tokens from the front desk). We also received excellent and accommodating turn-down service every day we were there (thanks Rosina)! VERY kid friendly! A clown named "Lollipop" showed up every day after 3 PM to entertain the kids. Balloon animals one day, magic the next, dress up the next, and so on! Very fun for the kids. Kid-friendly frozen drinks are available at the outside pool as well! IMPROVEMENTS I'D LIKE TO SEE, IN CASE THEY ARE READING THIS: There is only one elevator for the WHOLE hotel. This was a pain. They could use more to accommodate everyone. I hope they work on that in the future. Faster WiFi would be nice. More computers in the Computer room. New couches/convertible beds - though the bed was comfortable enough for kids, the couch was very uncomfortable. An ice machine on every floor would be great too. :) SUGGESTIONS FOR YOUR STAY: - Book on OCEANFRONT room. The extra $20/night was worth it for the view alone! - Try to get a room ABOVE the first floor. The foliage blocks your view of the ocean, and all the foot traffic seems to make the sandy area you walk out to a bit unclean and noisy. - Take advantage of the free fruit! It's delicious! - Don't bother brewing your own coffee in your room. It's just not as good as the coffee at a complimentary area near the elevator. They keep it well-stocked. Use your 4 cup carafe in your room to carry it back! :D - Take advantage of your small kitchen! Stock up on breakfast and lunch items; save your big $$$ for dinner! - Make sure the name of your significant other is listed on the hotel room. Do this when you check in and you won't have any problems if the other person needs a new key, or linens, etc. - Get (or rent) a beach cart if you have a large family! It will really help lug things around for you!

Reviews.Title: “Great Oceanfront experience!”
Reviews.Author: llamasocks
Reviews.Content: We brought a friend to OC to celebrate her 50th birthday and the Quality Inn Oceanfront was exactly what we had hoped it would be! I had read some other reviews that gave concerns about cleanliness, but I am glad that we made the decision to stay here. I really like reading about all the "details" in other's reviews, so will include the same in my review. We arrived for a 3 night stay in an oceanfront, ground floor room around 6pm on a Friday night; parking was available steps away from the lobby and check in was quick and easy. In the lobby there are baskets of complimentary fruit always available, as well as free local daily newspaper. Outside, across from the lobby, is the outdoor pool; just the right size and a great place to relax that is not "sandy". Outside the pool area is two children's play areas, as well as picnic tables and an outdoor (charcoal) grill. Past the lobby you enter the Atrium, which is an indoor area that houses the indoor pool, two hot tubs, tropical birds and fish pond/bridge, and the bar/grill. The indoor pool was fine, however, the hot tubs (unfortunately) were mostly inhabited by kids. 90% of our parties water time was spent in the ocean and the outdoor pool (which was great) so this didn't really bother me. We didn't eat at the bar/grill, so cannot comment on that either. The birds and fish were a really unusual and interesting touch to the indoor Atrium experience. On to our room, which was on the ground floor. The room was great for what we needed (oceanfront, enough space for 4 adults, with a kitchen). The sliding glass doors opened onto a patio with a small table and chair...three steps down from our patio and you were on the beach! You couldn't get a better location for ease of coming and going to the beach! The beds were comfortable, including the pull out couch. My only "complaint" with the bed were the scratchy pillowcases (I usually bring my own pillow but forgot). The kitchen had a full size fridge, a small 4 burner electric stove, and a microwave/coffee pot/can opener/toaster, and necessary plates and utensils. All in all we loved this hotel and would definately return again! Extra tips: Using the kitchen to prepare breakfast, lunch on the beach, and one nights' dinner really saved us money. There are ice machines on the 2nd floor (north end) and on the 4th floor (south end). Laundry on 2nd floor by the ice machine. The soda machines sell cans for only 40 cents. Be sure to grab some fruit in the lobby daily; it was fresh and not too "green" or "overripe". Free coffee with creamer cups (I hate the powdered stuff) and tea (Bigelow foil wrapped type) always available. If you are staying oceanfront and on the groundfloor, request a room closer to the north end; there is an outdoor back entrance with a ramp that makes unloading and loading the car much easier. There is a hose nearby this entrance to wash your feet or chairs when you return from the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel on the beach”
Reviews.Author: Bret E
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a two night stay at this hotel. Pros: right on the beach with direct beach access, two pools (indoor and outdoor), outdoor pool was perfect and enjoyable minus several men that couldn't use a sentence without dropping the f bomb, decent bathroom with heat lamp and tiled, atrium was nice with parrots and fish, check-out was quick and easy, staff was friendly and attentive to our requests of additional towels and covers. Cons: we heard constant noise from the people above us all night long, they were constantly opening and closing the sliding door to the balcony, the air conditioning seemed as if you always had to re-adjust it (I guess it would turn itself off), outdoor pool closes at dark, indoor pool had such a strong chlorine smell we chose not to use it, bathroom had previously used soap in the shower upon arrival, pull out sofa had so many hairs on it we chose not to use it, the toaster in the room was covered in grease and didn't work well, trash under the sink, there was a condom box under the pull out sofa. I know all hotels can have issues, but some of the above should have been addressed. It's evident that the cleaning staff do not pay attention to detail and do not thoroughly clean rooms between guests. Another positive, we didn't see any bugs or critters in the room in our three days there. Overall a decent stay, especially for the location. For the $634 we paid for two nights I did expect a much cleaner room and more attention to overall cleanliness. I am not sure that I would return for another stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great beach access”
Reviews.Author: Tnikki88
Reviews.Content: I was here a few days ago with my family. I picked this hotel because of the reviews and the beach access. Not a bad place to stay, but it definitely needs upgrading. The indoor pool area had trash on the ground and the light color tiles were dirty, there was also poor drainage.( standing water in pool area) I put water shoes on my kids. The elevators were also dirty, sometimes sweep but not washed. The cafe had too many flies;however the food was good. Our room needed some serious dusting, we found a dirty sock on the side of the couch, little dead bugs on the wall near the bed and some bad patch work by the air vent. I would rather stay in a hotel that appears to be clean then one that looks dirty, it was definitely a turn off! The up side was, the beds were comfortable and the staff was nice. I would stay here agian only if they upgraded the entire place and keep it cleaner..

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: PaulAK41
Reviews.Content: Nice quiet location with friendly and helpful staff. Our home away from home was roomy enough and clean. Easy bus or car ride to boarwalk to enjoy that experience. 2 pools & hot tubs. Would like adult only time for these amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite OC spot”
Reviews.Author: ellieirish
Reviews.Content: We love the ocean front views and the friendly staff here. You can't beat the right-on-the-beach location and the atrium is a nice diversion if you have little kids. As other reviewers have mentioned, there are some aspects of this hotel which are dated and perhaps a bit worn, but for us, it's part of the charm and does not detract from the fact that it's a great view from the balcony, there's a full kitchen where you can save money by doing your own breakfast and lunch, and there's a decent pool for when the beach becomes too much. Lots of kids in the indoor pool and hot tub area, so we wouldn't go near that, but if you have kids, that's the place to be. Overall, we love this place and come back every year.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Location and View!”
Reviews.Author: Laurel_Lye13
Reviews.Content: I traveled with my father and Grandmother. We had a little trouble finding the actual office but I think that was my Dad being a wacko and nothing against the hotel. We had an easy check in and walked through a very nice atrium with a koi pond, parrots, an indoor pool and a little cafe to the elevator (only oceanfront rooms have an elevator). We were on the third floor - the first has a balcony that steps out to the beach but I think the view might be a little blocked, second floor view may be blocked by palm trees but depends where you are on that floor) As it was our room had a very nice view of the ocean. And the balcony was nice to spend some time on watching the waves, I even saw what I think was a fox one night! The room had three beds - one of which was a pull out couch which was comfortable but I folded it up during the day for extra seating since the television is sort of in this room. Our A/C was set on 50 but it never actually got that cold, it was comfortable in the room though and at night the atrium lights are lowered to give a feeling of darkness in the hallway as well. I noticed in other reviews some people complained about the parrots sqwauking but I didn't have a problem with it. The birds are covered at the night and uncovered around 7-7:30 in the morning. When they are awake you can hear one every once in a while but it never woke any of us up. The kitchen was nice. A bit like cooking in a camper but with a bigger refrigerator. There were several pots and a frying pan provided, as well as a strainer. There were glasses, plates, bowls, mugs for six people. There was a two slice toaster and an electic can opener as well as a manual one. Also a bottle opener with corkscrew, a big spoon, pasta server, and holey spoon and silverware for six. I enede up buying a potato peeler and masher at the local Superfresh so bring those if you plan on doing mashed potatoes! There was a teeny dishwasher which was nice but the pots and strainer didn't fit so they had to be done by had. The stove was electric which I have at home so no problems there. For an idea of what you can cook, I made pork chops, peas, and mashed potatos and turkey cutlet, spinach and mashed potatos the next. The front desk has seasonings upon request but I brought my own. They provide towels and dishrags for the sink as well as dish soap and dishwashing powder. The bathroom was nice, not the typical hotel bathroom. It had a sink inside the bathroom, which I actually like batter. A nice big mirror along one wall and the shower worked well. The only weird thing about it was right across from the toilet was a full length mirror, a bit of a strange location for one if you ask me but whatever. We could take the elevator to the main floor and then walk out past a complimentary coffee and tea service to the beach (brochures and maps are through these doors if you are looking for them. One the way back in there was a curtesy hose to wash the sand off your feet before entering. I prefer the beach so I never used the pools but they looked very nice and there were always people in them but they never seemed over crowded. Overall, I thought this hotel was a bit expensive compared to what we usually pay but it was about average for the area, especially since it was right on the beach. It was a bit old (the mirror had some tarnish, the stove had a dent) but it was clean which is all I really care about.The staff was very helpful, the cleaning ladies were always very nice, we saw more of them than front desk staff- they always seemed to be cleaning something. It was a nice hotel, I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in Ocean City, will keep coming back!!”
Reviews.Author: kdraz99
Reviews.Content: This hotel is so clean, staff are extremely friendly. Great food at the Atrium restaurant. Have been going to this hotel for 5 years in a row and will not go anywhere else. Small drive to the boardwalk, private beach and very quiet at night. Perfect for families!! Highly recommend!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Oceanfront Getaway for the Price”
Reviews.Author: lilmx5guy
Reviews.Content: Just got back from 4 days and 3 nights in Ocean City, MD at the Quality Inn Oceanfront. Our stay was from 5/29 to 6/1. Check-in was fast and easy. They have a complimentary basket of fresh fruit and daily newspapers to the right of the check in counter. Rooms are a little dated but all of them feature full kitchens with four burner electric stove, apartment size refrigerator, microwave, compact dishwasher, coffee maker, electric can opener and a toaster. In the cabinets are silverware, glasses, coffee cups, pots, pans, and utensils. There is also free coffee 24 hours a day on the first level as you are heading towards the ocean by the elevators. We had a beachfront king room, and other people in our party had an oceanfront double. The beachfront room had sliding doors that opened to a small "porch" with two chairs and a table, walk down a few steps and your on the beach. the path through the dunes was right there outside our room. The other room was on the 5th floor with a balcony that had an awesome view of the beach and the ocean. It rained one of the days we were there, so the indoor pool and atrium were a blessing, since we were there with 3 grandchildren in our party. The indoor pool is nicely heated and has a 2 foot deep kiddie pool attached to it. There are 2 hot tubs located next to the indoor pool that really help ease the aches and pains from playing with the little ones all day. The outdoor pool is larger and deeper, with a 1 foot deep kiddie pool on the side. Next to the outdoor pool there is a pirate ship and a castle play area for the kids and picnic tables with charcoal grills for a cook out. The atrium area contains a small bridge over a "stream" that is surrounded by plants and contains many large fish and a turtle. There are also several birds in the atrium area, 2 large red macaws and 3 parrots were there during our stay. They open the cages up during the day while they take care of them, some of them climb on the to while others wander around the atrium. Rooms that were located on the street side of the building had balconies that overlooked the atrium. The atrium also contains a small restaurant and bar. The menu is limited to basic breakfast, lunch, and dinner fare, along with your typical bar food. The food we had was OK and it sure beat going out for something to eat when you don't feel up to it. The bar runs a happy hour from 4 to 7 which features $1.75 draft beer and $5.00 frozen drinks.The beds were comfortable and the rooms were clean. The front desk staff were very helpful and courteous, as was all of the cleaning and grounds staff and the bartender. With a full kitchen you have the option to go to the supermarket (there is a Super Fresh and a Food Lion down the road) and make a quick meal in the room. We had a great time and enjoyed the place for what it is. It's not a high service, high end romantic getaway for couples, but for families with kids or friends on a trip, it was just about perfect.

Reviews.Title: “A "Quality" Stay”
Reviews.Author: HonestGuyDelaware
Reviews.Content: Our favorite spot for multiple visits. New exterior paint/plants really spruces things up! Wonderful staff,comfortable rooms,pools,etc. The only complaint is the sofa needs upgrading.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: PennsylvaniaTurtle
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here in March. The staff was always friendly. The atrium was beautiful. We had a oceanfront room, so we did alot of sitting on the balcony watching the ocean and the sunrise every morning. The one night it became very foggy so it was nice to have the cafe to order food so we didn't have to drive anywhere. It was also nice having a kitchenette, especially the full sized fridge. The only reason I didn't give this an excellent is because the bed was so uncomfortable that my husband and I woke up with backaches every morning. Otherwise this is a great place.

Reviews.Title: “Great Getaway”
Reviews.Author: cruiserplanner
Reviews.Content: This is so what late but I had read some of the reviews prior to our going and I wanted to put my two cents in. Frist I must say that this was not the hotel I thought I was booking. My husband and I had stayed in Ocean city Md a few years back and we stayed at a choice hotel that was very nice but later ( afew days before we left for this get-a-way) I realized this was not the same hotel in fact the other was Comfort inn not Quality Inn Oceanfront. When I realized I got online and started checking reviews and they were not very favorable. Well we were very pleasantly surprised to found a very lovely room beautiful pool and great and friendly staff. We really enjoyed our time there and we plan to return again. w

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff - good bargain!”
Reviews.Content: Just got back from my first Ocean City, Md., group golf outing. Stayed at the Quality Inn Oceanfront. Check-in was fast, and they had our rooms ready before check-in time so we had some time to change and unpack before tee time. Our check-in people (Tanya and ?)were quite nice and efficient. There is a bowl of fresh fruit as well as daily papers to the right of the check in counter. These are complimentary to guests. Rooms are a little dated but feature full kitchens with electric stove, apartment size refrigerator, complimentary coffee packs and coffee maker. there is also free coffee on the first level going toward the ocean side by the elevators. After golf I enjoyed the indoor pool and Atrium setting. the pool is nicely heated. it really took out the aches and pains of senior life! the atrium setting was a lot of fun. there were several birds for company- including "kenwick" who says "hello" and "hola." a larger bird near the elevator station was quite demonstrative when he wants his food!!!! also a little fish pond, with some really big fish. loved the entire setting. plants are not natural- it was explained to me that they had real plants before but attracted too many insects. rooms were refreshed during the day; beds were comfortable and our rooms which were on the street side had back balconies that overlooked the atrium. very scenic for what it is. the small restaurant/bar did the job. the menu is small but servicable. breakfast runs about $4-$8. beats driving. bar is opened from about 8am till 11ish pm. kevin was our bartender-looks of fun with a great sense of humor. he gives it and he can dish it out! overall, we hade a great time for what it is. not the place for high end couples looking for a romantic get-away, but for families with kids and friends on a golf trip, it was A-OK!

Reviews.Title: “much improved”
Reviews.Author: donnae535
Reviews.Content: We stay usually once each winter, because kids have loved the atrium with pool and exotic birds.After many years place began to decline but we still kept going. This year all new bedding updated kitchens and baths. So fresh and new even the atrium is updated. Stayed last weekend and had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: MsJeep126
Reviews.Content: We just stayed for two nights at the Quality Inn, Oceanfront, Ocean City MD. Room 417 came equipped with a full refrigerator, stove/oven, dishwasher, electric can opener and microwave, plus toaster, kitchen utensils. The bed was a king pus a sleeper sofa with a privacy curtain. A great view of the ocean; small table with 2 chairs on balcony. Kitchen had two chairs, with a small table; ample closet and drawer space. Overall the room was very nice. The hotel was clean and also has a bar/restaurant - nothing fancy but service is good; indoor pool and separate hot tub. The ocean access is very easy; however you are 30 blocks from the boardwalk. We walked to two nice places for drinks/eats - Fagers on the Bay Front and Seacrets on the Bay Front, both within simply 6 block walking distance. I would highly recommend this hotel to my friends and family. We had to leave a day early due to an emergency at home and they did not charge us anthing extra for missing the third night. The staff was very nice and helpful. At the front desk there is a variety of fresh fruit available for guests which include apples, oranges and bananas-- free of charge along with coffee next to the beach access also free of charge all day. In front of the building is an outdoor pool and another hot tub. It is easy to reach this hotel from the Coastal Highway. Laytons was farther downtown but that was also a great place for breakfast -- if you order the Breakfast Burrito be very hungary or share it with a friend!! It is huge!! But very good food!!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice oceanfront hotel”
Reviews.Author: Barbara220
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with our room here at the Quality Inn. Almost like a trip back in time. We checked in at sunset and found the room to be complete and comfortable. The rooms are equipped so that you can fix yourself meals in your room and sit at the little dining table. The amenities in the bathroom are nice, there is coffee in the room. There is coffee and tea available down in the lobby near the exit to the ocean, right off the library. The Atrium Cafe off the lobby is small but the food is good and the staff is friendly. There are five beautiful birds in large cages in the lobby. There is also a very nice indoor koi pond that I didn't even notice until I was looking out over the lobby while waiting for the elevator. Some of the fish are quite large. There is a newspaper available daily and a bowl of fruit for customers. The bed and chairs were comfortable and relaxing. My only complaint was the noise. The rooms that face the ocean, line the interior of the building/lobby so that all activity in the lobby creates noise that echoes through the hotel. You can watch the kids play in the pool and from the time the pool opens around 9 AM til it closes at 10 PM, the shouting and screaming becomes quite annoying. There were a lot of children running along the hallway and the noise carries into the room. I wanted to go to sleep before 10 PM but couldn't because of the loud, loud noise. It is because of the noise that I rate this a 4 instead of a 5 but I would like to go back and stay there, when kids are in school! Another good point, the hotel is very close to the Route 50 bridge and in a good location in Ocean City.

Reviews.Title: “Best place we've stayed at”
Reviews.Author: boollllkstory2
Reviews.Content: Everything was great. We had a king bed efficiency with full fridge, stove, sink, dishes, pans, utensils, microwave, etc. -- for $64 a night! Plus, Nick, the night clerk went out of his way to clean up a jar of mushrooms we had dropped and broken while moving in. The whole staff was nice and friendly. We had a ground-floor room within steps of the inside pool, hot tubs, and Atrium Bar & Cafe. Everything was clean and well cared for, including the five beautiful tropical birds in cages. It reminded us of a high-class Las Vegas hotel, and we will recommend it to others every chance we get.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: poca1313
Reviews.Content: We stayed there too for my daughters cheer competition. Our stay was great. The rooms were very clean except for a few pieces of trash we found from previous occupants. The indoor pool was great and we visited the atrium bar a few times. Beds were comfortable and the view was fantastic, we were on the bottom floor and was able to walk right on the beach from our balcony. They even provided things like lotion make up remover shampoo conditioner....provided us with fresh towels. the kids had a blast at the pool party with the dj but if your going there to relax I suggest checking making sure nothing like this its going on because it got extremely loud. We would love to stay again but its a little too pricey for a normal ocean city visit, hopefully they willl choose this one again next season for her cheer competition.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible night, checked out early”
Reviews.Author: Vectorsmom
Reviews.Content: I booked a room for 3 nights starting on Saturday, Feb. 25th. When I arrived, I had a 3rd floor room with no elevator access (atrium view), so I had to carry all of my belongings up 3 flight of stairs. While the room was adequate, the room door was not sealed well, and the wind whistled loudly through it all night. There was a cheerleading competition in town, and the hotel had a DJ until 10pm in the atrium area - my room opened up to a balcony overlooking the atrium. When the DJ stopped, the noise continued until 3am, with both kids and their parents/chaperones talking and yelling constantly in the atrium area. At 1am, my room phone began to ring with kids looking for their friends. - obviously not supervised. About the 4th time it rang, I called the front desk, and they said they had no way of tracking who was calling, so I unplugged the phone. The next day things became quiet as the cheerleaders left, so I went out for the day. Before I left, I pulled the trash bags, and found old trash underneath them from someone's previous stay. Upon my return at 5pm, I found that my room had not been attended to by housekeeping, and when I called the front desk, I was informed that housekeeping was gone for the day. Being disappointed and tired from the night before, I decided to check out and move to another hotel. I did use the fitness room in the hotel in the morning, and it was very hot in there. I found a pair of earrings, most likely left by one of the cheerleaders. When I took these to the front desk, the woman working there tried to avoid looking at me and acted as if I was bothering her. In fact, the only person I encountered who was pleasant was the gentleman at the desk who checked me in and also checked me out when I left. I had originally booked the room because I read on line about the tropical birds in the atrium, but when I finally saw them on my second day, I was concerned about all of the kids whistling and trying to talk to them constantly. I can only imagine how traumatized they must have been with all of the noise from the night before. Not a relaxing environment at all as advertised.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend getaway”
Reviews.Author: HonestGuyDelaware
Reviews.Content: Cheerleader weekend. Yikes!! The management informed us this was a cheerleader contest weekend. Lots of kids,noise,but the facility did a nice job of handling it. We will definitely return on a QUIETER WEEKEND!!! Would definitely skip any OC Hotel during THIS WEEKEND,unless you're the participant(;

Reviews.Title: “weekend at Quality Inn in Ocean City MD”
Reviews.Author: mommomb
Reviews.Content: We stayed during a cheerleading competition where many of the teams stayed at the Quality Inn. When we booked we were given a "heads up" by the person taking our reservations. The hotel is undergoing a facelift on the outside but inside is beautiful. The rooms were so clean, and they staff thinks of everything, including disposable makeup remover in the bathroom!! The rooms all have small kitchenettes with pots, pans, dishes, and some units even have small dishwashers. The view from ALL the balconies is great! Each room over looks the tropical settings of the pool, 2 hot tubs, and a little bar/cafe where the food is delicious and very inexpensive. There are glass elevators that can take you to your inside rooms, but we were on the outside and it was only 1 small flight upstairs. Not a big deal at all. There are plants, exotic birds and a very friendly staff to help navigate you to anywhere or to supply whatever your needs are. The rooms have double beds, but also pull out couches. Within the rooms there is a curtain you can pull across between the beds and the couch. Very family friendly. The staff was always vacuuming, cleaning, replenishing the coffee and tea machine set up on the ground level by the pool. I would definitely recommend this to anyone. The only problem we had, and it wasn't the fault of the hotel, was there was a power outage in part of the hotel and outside on the same street. When that happened there were people in the elevator. The fire dept. quickly came and opened the doors, but some of the people that stayed with the cheer competiton were extremely rude to the staff and due to circumstances that were not the fault of the hotel, they still demanded to have their rooms comped and also wanted their food comped!! The management did everything they could to be accomodating, but they still had plenty of beligerent people to contend with. My hats off to the friendly staff for just smiling and being as helpful as they could. I would go back there anytime. It is right on the beach and has a beautiful view from the rooms facing the ocean. They are very close to everything....food stores, restaurants, drug stores, etc. I also know that they accomodate golfers during their stay. 5 stars!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: Susan M
Reviews.Content: We booked for just a getaway weekend in February. The Atrium was just beautiul and the staff was helpful and friendly. I loved the tropical birds and the Koi pond in the Atrium. We had a quick dinner the first night in the Atrium Cafe, it was tasty, prepared quickly and served with a smile. We had the pleasure if meeting the lady who cares for the birds everyday and she was gracious enough to spend time educating and giving us a greater appreciation for the unique personalities of each one of them. Overall it was a very pleasent stay. The outside of the building could use a facelift (there was a crew working on the facade as we were checking out)but our room was clean, spacious and pleasent.

Reviews.Title: “The Quiet Roar of Ocean City~”
Reviews.Author: DERRICK M
Reviews.Content: I shamefully admit that i, like so many others have grossly underscored the Quality Inn brand, expecting the standard "Inn" experience - which is, bed, bath (but not much beyond.lol) But was immediately awestruck at a spacious oceanview room-fully equipped kitchen (including flatware!) A Hot Tub and pool were nice accents to a lavish atrium with exotic birds and a running pond coursing with live colorful fish! but the closer that caught completely off guard - was when i drew the drapes at 715am my first morning - to behold the most breathtaking Sunrise I've ever beholded! (and I've been to Honolulu ~ and it beat even that one! You cant believe this value!

Reviews.Title: “Great Super Bowl Weekend!”
Reviews.Author: Barb M
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 3 night, Super Bowl Weekend with 6 of our friends. What a blast! The hotel has been completely renovated and updated and is just beautiful. We love the tropical atmosphere in the atrium area with the palm trees and exotic birds, koi pond and beautiful lighting. The pool area is as pretty as the picture and the hot tubs very relaxing. The entire hotel staff that we encountered were so nice and accommodating and at times joined in on our fun - Thank you Mr. Sticky!!! We started in a 2nd floor atrium view room but asked the next morning if there were any 1st floor rooms available. There was and the front desk clerk was happy to make the change for us. In our haste to move our belongings to our new room, I left a phone charger plugged in an outlet and my robe hanging behind the bathroom door of our old room. Upon inquiring at the desk about these items, they were quick to issue a door key to me to check it out as the room was still available. The maid had already finished the room and my things weren't in there but she turned everything in to the front office where I was able to pick them up later in the day. THEN, to bug the front desk staff some more, I realized later that night that I had left a special beer glass in the kitchen cabinet of our old room and asked if anyone had moved into the room yet. They said someone was in there but, shortly after, Mr. Sticky was at my door with my beer glass!!! He was just wonderful and could have really gotten annoyed with me but instead, had a great sense of humor and did everything he could to make our stay enjoyable. He even issued 2 free drink coupons to my husband for having to put up with me!!! When we returned home I checked their rates for spring break week (I work in a school) and went ahead and made reservations for a few nights that week - That's right Mr. Sticky - I'm coming back!!! Thanks so much for making our getaway weekend so wonderful!!! I can't wait to come back!!

Reviews.Title: “After all these years still what I expected-terrific!!!!”
Reviews.Author: avalonlion
Reviews.Content: My girls & I stayed here many many years ago. We enjoyed it so much that I recently booked a long weekened for me & my boyfriend. It was just as great now as back than if not more-we had an outside room which I knew ment that we had to walk around to get to the indoor pool & bar but it was so worth it-price was cheaper & the room was more private, Could not have asked for more & will be returning. Oh & I forgot to mention that we were well situated between 2 sports bars during the football palyoffs!

Reviews.Title: “Some good some not so good”
Reviews.Author: PattiJ52
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Quality Inn Oceanfront Dec 27th for 3 nights. The room was very large and spacious , it had a dishwasher, large refrigerator, stove, microwave, toaster, dishes etc.For the most part it was clean, except the tub and the coffee pot. The closet door was off the track, the remote for the TV didn't work even with new batteries, and a lamp was broke in 1/2. The bed was cheap and very uncomfortable. The balcony looked over the atrium, where there was a cafe, swimming pool and birds. Late night noise coming from the swimming pool was noticable even though we were on the 3rd floor. The room had an exterior extrance and the light outside was very bright which made the room too bright at night. Had to cover the window with a towel. Our room was on the 3rd floor and there was no elevator, had to climb 3 flights of exterior stairs to get to our floor, being handicapped this was a difficult task. There was no breakfast at this hotel, but apples and over ripe bananas were available in the lobby. There was coffee and tea in the atrium. Never being to the area before, I assumed an Oceanfront hotel with a balcony meant that the balcony looked out over the ocean, when it actually looked into the atrium. All in all when it comes to hotels, my main concern is that it is clean. The room itself was very clean except for the tub which had hairs in it, the coffee pot had not been cleaned and had dried coffee in it. I striped back the bedding to check the mattress and it was clean, although about the cheapest mattress I've ever seen. I wouldn't stay there again due to the lack of an elevator and the bed being uncomfortable. I think it would be a nice place for a family to stay if their main interest was being on the beach most of the day. The large room and kitchen were a plus and would be nice if you wanted to eat in. There is a nice area to sit outside your room in the good weather.

Reviews.Title: “Never going back”
Reviews.Author: BRK28970
Reviews.Content: The pool was toxic, smelled horrible, one young boy passed out and drowned, only to be resuscitated -- the whole place left a disgusting smell on our clothes and hair. The hot tubs especially stunk. Like no chlorine in the pools. Roaches in the rooms, doors had to be forced, We had to come home and throw everything into the washer because of the horrible smell. My guess is that the hurricane messed this place up big time. This used to be our favorite hotel but we are never going back.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty, Unkept, Old Hotel”
Reviews.Author: duckiebell
Reviews.Content: I thought this would be the best of the Quality Inn Hotels in the ocean city area since their room prices were a bit higher than the other two but this hotel was actually the worst. I first took notice upon checking in at the front desk how old he hotel looked. When we entered our room it did not give me a warm welcoming feeling at all. There were large pieces of molding trim missing from the dresser, the chair had large stains all over the upholstery, there was a black hair in the bathtub, a 3 inch rip in the bedskirt and the furnishings were all outdated. The tv was the large boxy type with very poor reception. The picture was snowy the whole time. We paid for an oceanfront room and the website played up this atrium lobby they have which I thought would be appealing but even on the top floor we could hear the parrots squalking loudly. Thank goodness they cover them up at night to quiet them down. Don't try napping during the day though. I left the bathroom light on with the door partially closed to use as a nightlight. When I got up in the middle of the night there was a roach scattering across the bathroom floor. Mind you I had not just turned the light on...it had been left of so if this critter was bold enough to be out in the light I am sure there are more of them. The king size bed was so uncomfortable because it sank down in the middle. Even with 2 people sleeping on either side your body kept rolling toward the middle. I slept poorly because of the bed and the roach spotting. I would never recommend a stay at this hotel even if it is on the ocean.

Reviews.Title: “very pleased with accomodations and staff”
Reviews.Author: mary k
Reviews.Content: the room was very clean and staff very friendly. this was our third visit and we have always been pleased. the atrium and pool area very inviting on Saturday we had lots of wind and rain, it was the weekend with the Nor'easter. We had ocean front and a beautiful view of Mother nature's fury with the wind blown seas. Also use of computers and wifi. FRESH HOT COFFEE EACH MORNING AND FRUIT GREAT FRIENDS WEEKEND. READY FOR ANOTHER ONE!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful vacation”
Reviews.Author: Liam M
Reviews.Content: Love the atrium, Tina, the lady that takes care of the birds was very friendly and knowledgeable. The front desk staff were friendly and helpful (recommended several local restaurants and we enjoyed them all). We love the fact that the rooms have kitchens in them and the dividers between the beds and sofa bed are a nice feature for travelers with children.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome atrium....GRUMPY STAFF!”
Reviews.Author: kcard82
Reviews.Content: The atrium of this hotel is its saving grace. It kept my kids entertained for hours when it was raining the morning after we got here. Also, the location is also great, I love being right on the ocean and listening to the waves at night. I liked having a kitchenette but the second night I was here ANTS were crawling on the countertop. One thing that I noticed most of all is that the staff is SO INCREDIBLY GRUMPY! The only nice people are the ones who staff the Atrium Cafe. That's it. Everyone else has a stick up their you know whats. I went to the front desk to ask a question and one of the staff members was on the phone with a customer and he was rolling his eyes, banging his fists and throwing his hands up in the air. It was really uncomfortable. The girl who came to feed the birds (who looks EXACTLY like the hiccup girl) barely made eye contact with anyone. She was just generally pissed off. Then, when I came to the front desk to return the movies, I saw a woman sitting at a desk, I said "hello!" 3x and she completed ignored me. Then, some other grumpy dude came out and took my movies back. It seems like the people who work here get a rise out of being jerks.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms are Complete Dumps!!”
Reviews.Author: Travelogists2
Reviews.Content: We choose to stay in this hotel due to the great price, location, and photos online. The outside area and atrium area are very clean, orderly and pleasant. Our room however was disgusting, the doors wouldn't open without using force. The room was disgusting with other people's bodily hair in large piles in the corner of the bathroom, large gaps under the electrical plates, and stains on the chair. We called down to the front desk when we realized our door wouldn't lock properly waited over 20 minutes until my husband went down to get someone when the lady working at the desk told him she hadn't even called it in yet and told us that the door not locking wasn't a big deal. Eventually they switched our room but had the nerve to ask my husband if they needed to clean the room since we had only been there 4 hours. I would advise anyone looking at this hotel not to stay there under any circumstances unless you want to reside in flith.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: OceanCruiser60
Reviews.Content: Did like the Atrium, birds and fruit baset available. The rooms (at least the one we stayed in) really need attention. Blow dryer would work for a few minutes and quit and then start again. Tried to call the front desk to discover the phone wouldn't work. Had to send husband down to front desk. In their defense they did send someone up with a new blowdryer and phone within 10 minutes. Of course this was September and off season so they weren't that busy. The room smelled awful (moldy, musty) I could hardly stand the smell. The air-conditioner termastat did not work. You could turn it up to 90 and the air conditioning wouldn't turn off. It just ran and ran and the room got colder and colder. Had to turn it off and on to be comfortable. The screen door to balcony was off track as was the glass sliding closet door. As for cleaning, someone came in every day and made the bed and replenished towels but did nothing else. Kitchen table remained dirty, nothing was dusted or cleaned the entire week. We just tried not to look around too much. Very difficult even for two people to use the tiny table to eat on. Took food for breakfast and lunches but it was difficult to get out food and use the table. I would give it a 1 star rating but gave it 2 stars because of them taking care of our phone and dryer so quickly and the atrium. It does not deserve the high rating it has and will not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “OK”
Reviews.Author: dawn1226
Reviews.Content: Room was nice and was clean. Front desk staff was terrific. Nice big basket of fruit available to us all day every day. Pool and outdoor bar was also great. I wouldn't go in their indoor spa if you paid me....looked rather dirty. Right on the beach...really nice, price wasn't bad. Great location around 58th St. as I recall. Downside....my car was dinged immediately upon arrival...as we were checking in. Parking spaces could be a little bigger--they're rather tight. Watch out for the guy lingering in the stairwells....swear he was there every single time we came and went...sitting on the steps with his cell phone...not working--hope they fired him...he was creepy.

Reviews.Title: “What a Disappointment...”
Reviews.Author: GreatAunt_11
Reviews.Content: The check-in area is less than inviting, the person that checked us in was professional and friendly. The outdoor pool is in front of the hotel between 2 parking lots so there is no covered area to drive up to the front door. Luckily we had an Oceanfront room and could use an elevator once we were checked in, because there is not an elevator for the Atrium rooms only stairs from the front of the hotel. I guess that's why there are only pictures of the back of the hotel on the website. Not suitable for anyone with the least amount of stair climbing problems. Our "suite" was small and not the best. Although I believe that after reading some of the reviews (which I wish I had read before we booked our suite) that our room had been renovated. Obviously not a 1st class job. The a/c was on 66 when we arrived and the room smelled like cinnamon clearly in an attempt to cover up other odors. The spigot in the tub had enough black crud / mold you could see through the plastic that it was sickening. When we returned to the room after dinner the first night and switched on the light there was a huge roach in the sink. The birds in the lobby were so noisy that it was impossible to sleep. The only elevator the guests could use was impossible, so slow we had to wait and everyone complained about it. The heated pool in the Atrium was not heated, too cold for anyone to use even the children didn't stay in it. The hot tubs were filthy. The tile floor going to the elevator was always wet and slippery. The doors to the beach stayed filthy. The free beverages were not always ready or available when they should have been. There was an old blood stain on the comforter which was addressed quickly. The outdoor pool was okay but the kiddie pool was awful. One of the guests said that her children were calling it the kiddie swamp. I have to agree with them. For the most part the staff was less than welcoming. The person that checked us out was neither professional or friendly and could have cared less about our stay or if we were coming back, which I can assure you we are not! We had a wonderful view of the ocean but the price was too high for these less than "quality " accomodations. I notice that the slogan for Quality Inn is" Get a lot for a little" well we "got a little for a lot."

Reviews.Title: “Atrium Room Means No Elevator and No Help”
Reviews.Author: travelingdoc42
Reviews.Content: Beware that most “Atrium” rooms are up one or two flights of stairs. There is no access to any elevator for these rooms. Also this hotel will not help anyone carry bags (no bell staff & not something front desk staff offers to do). More expensive “Ocean View” rooms are all accessible by elevator. Ocean View rooms cover 5 floors and served by a single very slow (& usually dirty- but that is probably more a reflection of cliental & sandy beach than hotel) elevator. Hotel rooms are very old fashioned but do include range, microwave, refrigerator and automatic dishwater. TV was an ancient CRT type with poor reception of most channels and no reception of channels like FOX news. Front desk just blamed Cable Company and was of no help. Mold on ceiling activated my wife’s allergies. Water pressure was very good & there always was plenty of hot water. Room was very quiet, even though hotel was full of a lot of families. Free coffee was available around the clock. The Wi-Fi was free & fine. There was no desk, but there was a tiny kitchen table that made do. The Ocean view was fine. The hotel is 100% non-smoking and does not allow pets…. 2 positives for me but negatives for some. Parking was abundant, convenient and free.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location!”
Reviews.Author: keywest06
Reviews.Content: We reserved an oceanfront room at the hotel and it was right in front of the sand dunes with a private balcony that had stairs to go onto the beach. The room was large and clean and we had plenty of towels. We also loved spending time at the pool outside, which was large and had plenty of chairs. The Atrium was a treat too-I had a fun time going to see the parrots. The only problem was-we had to be evacuated because of Hurrican Irene and had to cut our trip 2 days short. We will definitely come back. :)

Reviews.Title: “new summer vacation spot”
Reviews.Author: raydo88
Reviews.Content: The price is high for peak season. we stayed for 4 nights at 279 a night. But my 5 yr old had a blast, from getting to sleep in his own sofa that turned into a bed (he truly loved it), to the parrots and talking to them everyday, to swimming or going right to the beach. Had a first floor atruim side room w king bed. This was not a problem but if you get 2 or 3 floor atruim side you have to walk up steps on the outside to get to your room. the room was clean but there was one problem the sleeping area to the kittchen, the floor was raised up and was a trip hazzard (it was raised by at least 1-2 inches). Check in was not a problem (got there at 12:45 pm and room was ready for a 3:00 ckeck in time) and check out was less than 1 minute. I'm sure their are plenty of places to stay at a cheaper cost. But I know where the family will be booking for next year. Need to be a tad cheaper

Reviews.Title: “Pleasntly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: mal
Reviews.Content: OK, so I regularly stay at a Quality Inn in College Park for business and it's fine for business, but not a place I'd take my wife, so I was a bit hesitant to book at a Quality Inn at the beach. However, this place was really decent...the room was clean, the bed was super comfortable, and the location was pretty decent (within walking distance to Seacrets and Old Pro golf). I split this reservation between points for one night and pay for the other, so I booked over the phone at 1-800-choicehotels (or whatever their number is!). it was a real struggle to try and get the same room for both nights (and a 1st floor beach front room)over the phone, but when i called the front desk at QI they were able to do this very quickly (and were very friendly about it!) having the beach front room was cool--you walk right out onto the beach! however, you still need to have somebody go through the hotel (unless you want to leave your patio unlocked) :) the other thing about having the beach front room was that it was an "accessible room" so it had a handicapped shower with a pretty sucky (low-flow) shower head, but it was no big deal. also, one other nice thing is that there are $1 coke machines througout the property... overall, i would highly reccommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “great location and atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: queenhs1
Reviews.Content: The night manager was wonderful from check-in til check-out! The beach at this location is not as crowded as the boardwalk area which is why we enjoy being here. The rooms are clean and spacious, but could use some updating. There is plenty for the kids to do and just a great atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Kids loved it. We will return.”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer B
Reviews.Content: When I first pulled into the parking lot I was worried. The outside is a little run down. But once I was in the door I was very pleased. The room was large, clean, and as described in the listing. They have 2 pools (one indoor and one outdoor). The outdoor pool has a nice little bar. The beach was great. Easy access, clean. My kids just loved Dylan, a bird that lives in the Atrium. When we checked out, they offered to let us continue using the beach and parking lot for the day and the use of their showers at the end of the day. I will definatly go back.

Reviews.Title: “Aging gracefully!”
Reviews.Author: Decembergem7
Reviews.Content: My kids love the many things to do here...indoor/outdoor pool...game room...several public jacuzzi's...play area for toddlers...good pizza & just a few steps and your on the beach!

Reviews.Title: “ok, but not my 1st choice again”
Reviews.Author: Michelle20113006
Reviews.Content: We just visited here for a quick vacation. I wanted oceanfront and was able to get a room here. We were on the 2nd floor. It was fairly quiet and I could not hear any noise from the neighbors. We did hear the birds in the morning when the lady who cares for them lets them out, but that is part of the tropical atmopsphere and we liked it. The birds are in the cage all the rest of the time. They talk more when out. They do not typically fly around but visit one another(when out of the cages). I must say my husband and I stayed here some 20 yrs ago and it was a great place then. Since, many newer hotels have been built. This hotel has been updated,but it still shows the wear and tear the ocean and many visitors can bring. I feel the beds could really be upgraded and the room furniture as well. For the money you pay you expect a better QUALTITY. The rooms are tight,especially in the kitchenette area as they have a table and 2 chairs here,nice but very tight. We did not use the stove or microwave and not sure I would want to. The stove was little rusty and grimey. We never had touble parking, they have a large lot,however checking in you have to pull up as close as you can,bring out the luggage rack and then go park you car. There really is not designated place to do this and you block others in. There is a nice indoor and outdoor pool. The Atrium cafe is right there for a quick snack. Overall- pro's- oceanfront-can't get any better then that. clean tropical atmosphere quiet a/c Con's- outdated sand everywhere-yes I know your at the beach-but I have stayed elsewhere and they manage to keep up with it hard to get in to register-a few parking spots for checkin would help if you stay in Atrium room be aware there is no elevator in side, you must take outside stairs to your room. my kids loved walking through the atrium area seeing the birds,fish and turtles I loved being right on the beach.

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE AND DIRTY”
Reviews.Author: monisec
Reviews.Content: When I booked my room I was told that the oceanfront rooms had been renoviated! When I got there I knew as soon as I walked in that i had made a big mistake!! This hotel is dirty, old and smells damp. The carpert is dirty, the tub had rust, the toilet made a loud noise whenever you flushed it. The elevators are soooo old, and small I was scared to ride in them but I had to. The game room SMELLED LIKE URINE!! DONT FALL FOR THE PICTURES THAT YOU SEE!! What a waste of money!! The lobby looks dirty and run down!! If you like a nice clean, upgraded and nice smelling hotel this is not the place for you!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: kae23
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night after staying 2 nights in Rehoboth Beach, DE. We asked for a early check-in and was given permission to enter the room when we arrived at 1pm. Our room was right by the beach access door/elevator; if we were there any longer I would have asked for a different room. The lobby was beautiful with decor' and the birds in the middle were a cool effect. I am not a fan of birds and was glad to see them caged. The kids were impressed with them. The indoor pool area was loud at night which I thought I might have had to contact Front Desk but come 10pm it was very quiet. The room was clean. The carpet in our room was in very good condition, esp. for being on the first floor with access to the beach. I would recommend this hotel to others. It was a good location and had bus access coming and going down to the pier.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded our expectations! Great Beach hotel...”
Reviews.Author: dianew1
Reviews.Content: My husband & I arrived on Sat Jul 23...a bit early, & we were told our room wasn't quite ready which we expected. The front desk was extremely friendly & offered to call us when our room was ready, which they thought would be 1:00pm. We went to the beach in front of the hotel & rented chairs & an umbrella. Hotel called us at about 11:30 & our room was ready for check in! The lobby is fun! Tropical birds, fish, an indoor pool & bar...great for familes :) Our room was lovely..& a nice balcony with perfect view of the ocean. The next morning, from our balcony we saw many, many dolphins in the water in front of us! A great show! We drove down to 1st St in Ocean City to walk around the boardwalk and hang out...very fun! Do not hesitate to stay at this Quality Inn!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Customer service”
Reviews.Author: Guayopari
Reviews.Content: We stayed here July 14 through July19 and we couldn't be happier with the location, accommodation and customer service. The night manager Melody upgraded our room to an ocean view which made our stay that much better. The resort is right on the beach. Access to the beach was a sinch. The room was fine, perhaps a bit dated but it was clean. I love that it is away from the boardwalk and from all the commotion but close enough if you do want to go (short drive). I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “What a View”
Reviews.Author: Pghjanedoe
Reviews.Content: Decent place for the money. We had an oceanfront room and LOVED the view from the nice sized balcony. The staff for the most part was very nice. Regina cleaned our room daily and was efficient. We had a malfunction with the screendoor leading to the balcony. The maintinence man tried to fix it but couldn't so he replaced it with a new one. Thank goodness! We loved the smell and sounds from the ocean since we were so close. There are large tropical birds (in cages) in the atrium. Kids seemed to love them. Someone mentioned they made a lot of noise in a previous review of this hotel. They did make noise BUT only during the day and I didn't find it annoying at all. It kinda added to the whole tropical effect. One of the few places I have seen with an indoor and outdoor pool. We would stay here again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again”
Reviews.Author: clevelandgirl99
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a week with an 11 & 13 yr old. Location was great for us. We took bus to boardwalk a couple times and drove to Delaware for dinner once. The outdoor pool was clean and it was nice to have the option of getting a drink or snack poolside. The indoor pool was dark and seemed a bit dirty. (People need to rinse sand off themselves before going in a pool!) Was nice having a kitchen. Was small but worked well for breakfast and lunch. We were on 5th floor and the view was great!
