There are a number of parrots in the hotel atrium - unfortunately they are LOUD. They woke us up every morning. Next, the atrium / pool area....is just a mess. Extension cords all over the pool area, abandoned hot-tubs, cheaply done decorating, etc. It was clear the hotel was going for a jungle / oasis / atrium motif, but instead it comes across as a messy petting zoo. Not to mention the STRONG and NASTY smell of over-kill rug spray. The hotel smelled BAD. I would not go back...

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful accommodations and great service!”
Reviews.Author: mlgiles3
Reviews.Content: This is not the first time I have stayed at the Quality Inn Oceanfront, but I can say the service gets better each time. The value for your money is excellent. Right on the beach, near the boardwalk, shopping, restaurants, etc. Had a ocean view that could not be beat! Desk Clerks, Daisy and Lara, and Management, Dan and Donna, are most gracious. Always willing to provide answers and directions. Very friendly and professional. Housekeeping staff was always nearby if you needed something and they have towels available for you to use for the pools! Loved "The Atrium" Cafe and the birds!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Ocean View, Comfortable Room”
Reviews.Author: Jackzig
Reviews.Content: OK, the rooms are a little dated, but they are very comfortable, and very clean. We had an ocean front room with a king size bed on the second floor. The bed was great, the linens were fresh and clean. The view was to die for. We had breakfast on the balcony every morning while watching the waves, and enjoyed a glass of wine in the evening while the full moon played on the ocean. My wife and I have stayed here for several years, and plan to come back again. We had no problems with the air conditioning and saw no signs of mold or bugs. The staff was friendly and helped us plan a day trip to Crisfield. This is not a luxury hotel if that;s what your looking for try another hotel. If however you're looking for a clean, comfortable room with a beautiful view of the ocean, at a reasonable price, this is it.

Reviews.Title: “We can't wait to go back.”
Reviews.Author: dricha0809
Reviews.Content: My family and I had a great time on are weekend get away. Staff is very nice from the time we got there until the time we departed. Room was very clean and the beds were great I have a bad back and I got up with no pain every morning. We loved the birds they all have names and we injoyed talking to all of them. The indoor pool was just like getting in a nice warm bath tub so the kids didn't cry that they didn't want to go to the pool. My family enjoy the game room and I really enjoyed the tanning bed. We will be planning a return visit this summer.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: tmrush
Reviews.Content: We were unable to afford a week at the beach this year but wanted to take our kids for at least a couple of days. This hotel looked nice on the web and realy did have all the amenities to make kids happy but I found it to be really dirty and run down. The website claims the rooms are all remodeled but I'm not realy sure what their actual definition of remodeled is. The only thing in the room that appeared to be new was the bedding and some of the bathroom. The carpet was sticky so we had to wear shoes or socks the entire time, the room smelled really bad, the couch was stained and the door jamb fell off of the door. The lobby smelled like vomit .We were going to stay an extra night and suck it up because our children loved it there and don't really notice the same details adults do but our last night there my son was woken up by young drunk guys in the room across the pool area who were screaming that they were going to kill everyone and throwing furniture around. My son got really upset and needless to say my husband and I got no sleep. The staff did address the issue promptly. Even though my children were really disappointed I was not willing to pay another $245 for another night. The staff was extremely nice and if they actually did remodel the rooms and lobby this place would be great. The outside pool are was really nice and the inside and outside bars were brand new. The inside jacuzzis and pool looked kind of dirty but I didnn't actually use them. This was probably the nicest part.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience and Wonderful Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Nothome-OnaVacation
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel via Google and checked out their web site. They were running a fall special, Sunday through Thursday - stay three nights for the price of two. Our room was oceanfront with two double beds and full kitchen, clean with comfortable beds, extra pillows and great blankets. The indoor pool was clean and the hot tubs were sanitized daily. The two Sauna's were dated and could use a good cleaning, but worked and felt great. Free laundry (ask for tokens at the front desk) was a blessing. The food and drinks served by the hotel restaurant were a bargain and very good. Their atrium is full of plants, birds and fish. A nice diversion. The staff was attentive and friendly. It is just a few steps from the elevator to the beach. We had such a great time we extended our stay another night (had the weather held we would probably still be there!) A great experience and wonderful stay!

Reviews.Title: “If you don't mind fungus and toxic mold this is the place for you”
Reviews.Author: frequentraveler001
Reviews.Content: The gravest concern we had was the mushroom like structures growing out of the carpet and walls (see attached photo). Admittedly, I'm not a scientist nor did I take a sample and send it off to a lab but I think that any reasonable person would conclude that there is a massive fungal problem. Not to mention the black spots growing out of the bathroom walls which appeared to be mold. Other than that that the A/C didn't work, the drains were broken and clogged and the half of the lamps didn't turn on. The pools were filthy and the room smelled (as did all of our belongings, clothes etc.) after we left. I bet the health department would be interested in this. As far as minor stuff.... well, there was no thermostat in the room and we had to call maintenance to adjust the temperature. The TV is small and no where near the beds (the tv was near the couch). If you like to watch TV in bed, forget it! Speaking of beds ... very uncomfortable! If you didn't have a back ache before you arrived, you might after you leave, we did. The bugs in the room didn't add to the charm either. Oh yeah, and if you have a nice car, I hope you don't mind leaving it out on the street because there are very few parking spots in the actual motel lot. The motel is not walking distance from the boardwalk either.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mermaidlah
Reviews.Content: I stay in this hotel every September for a week (for the past seven years), and I never want to leave! Hotel feels tropical with the indoor pool, birds and foliage. No complaints at all - Rooms are very nice and clean; hotel staff friendly and accommodating. Good food at the Atrium Cafe. Free use of washer and dryer. Great location for walking to dinner/nightlife.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Suprized”
Reviews.Author: theboom
Reviews.Content: To begin with, I booked my vacation through AAA before reading the reviews of this place on this website. After reading some of them, I was a little worried about spending my anniversary there. But because my wife and I aren't very picky, I decided to try it. Lets start from the beginning: The hotel was easy to find, and was right on the main road with a large sign. The parking situation which can be a pain in OC was easy and there was plenty available. There is a pool outside by the parking lot before you enter the hotel, usually filled with kids, but the area was clean, and so was the pool. Kids were usually kept under control by their parents. The entrances to the older part of the hotel are outside, on the road side, and have balconies overlooking the pool/parking lot area. The lobby was small, but the staff was helpful and friendly, and there was always a stocked fruit basket with bananas, peaches, etc. Through the lobby was the atrium. I was expecting more plats, and less open space, but it was nice and there were birds in cages for people to look at, and "talk" to! Also in the atrium is a bar/restaurant which is reasonably priced. To the south end is a pool and two hot tubs. The pool was a little dirty, mostly with sand from the beach, and one of the hot tubs was empty most of the time. The rooms were OK. Nothing special. When we walked in, it looked nice but felt a little dirty and moist. The kitchen area was nice, the broiler under the stove was NASTY, and I was scared to open it. We did use the kitchen though, and their dishes. The bathroom was kinda dingy, wallpaper was peeling near the top of the wall where there were a couple of holes. The shower did have mold around the caulk if a few spots. The reviews that mention water pressure problems were not exaggerating! NO PRESSURE! And the water temp is always changing. Not to extreme amounts, but enough to make me want to rush it. The bed/tv area was very nice, but the carpet was kinda nasty. The A/C worked fine. The balcony overlooking the atrium was just about useless unless you want to look at pasty old people and kids that are scared to go in the ocean. The birds don't make hardly any noise, and are covered during sleeping hours. The people in the room next to us were very loud and obnoxious. but they were friendly, and at about eleven every night they went in to bed. The ocean area in front of the hotel was nice and clean and supervised by a lifeguard. In retrospect, I'd stay there again. I wasn't crazy about the place, but where else in OC are you going to find an oceanfront hotel with efficiency units, two pools, free parking, etc. for $150 per night?

Reviews.Title: “Can't Wait To Return”
Reviews.Author: MorgansGranny
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at the Quality Inn Oceanfront! Right on the beach ... pool was on street side, but secluded. Keep up nicely, too! Inside staff was very helpful. If you needed something, you got it immediately! Inside pool and atrium was something I haven't seen at any hotel. The birds are let out of their cages (only when staff is there) and they talk and are friendly with the customers. Food at the inside Tiki Bar was very reasonably priced and good! We had a great time and can't wait to return! P.S. Mary of housekeeping took very good care of us!

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience oceanfront”
Reviews.Author: mom2morgan
Reviews.Content: We had an ocean front room on the 4th floor and felt so good about the hotel. The staff was helpful and the birds were a nice difference. We look forward to returning to the hotel this September.

Reviews.Title: “Worry Free Hotel - Fabulous Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Tazdoc1
Reviews.Content: I'm writing this review because reading the reviews on this website is what helped me make my final decision to book this hotel. So I'm hoping that my input will help someone else as well. First the PROS: LOCATION: Perfect!! It's located on 54th & Coastal Hgwy. in Ocean City, MD which is far enough away from the noise and crowds of downtown and the boardwalk but not so far it's a pain in the butt to get there when you want. It's close to the Convention Center (if you care), close to restaraunts, clubs, amusements, gas stations, and supermarkets. The beach is guarded/private, uncongested and CLEAN! HOTEL: Room Service - very accomodating, attentive, and on point. Decor - very tropical, "beachy", and clean. The beds were the most comfortable I've ever slept on in ANY hotel. Even my 16yr. old, fussy daughter raved of how she wished she could take the mattress home!! Our room was an non-smoking oceanfront efficiency with a spectacular view of the beach and ocean from the 4th floor. The balcony, complete with table and chairs was private with walls on both sides so you weren't staring down your neighbors throat. The back of the hotel also featured shaded hammocks that were incredibly relaxing enough to lull you to sleep with the cool ocean breeze caressing you, the waves crashing in the background - my gosh! What a treat!! Anyway, the room was big enough to sleep 6 people which included my husband and I, our three children plus my neice (ages 11, 15,16, and 18yrs old). The dresser and closet was even ample enough for us all to unpack and stow our luggage away without tripping over each other! The kitchen was fully stocked and came with a dishwasher and soap, stove with an oven, refrigerator and freezer. It took the headache & expense out of eating out all the time! The bathroom was decent enough with a tub/shower combo with a massaging shower head but my main reason for mentioning it in this review is that I was relieved that six people were able to shower back to back without the water pressure changing or the hot water running out!!! Loved the outdoor pool and pool bar. Loved the indoor heated pool, jacuzzi, and Atrium bar. LOVED THE TROPICAL ATRIUM, PERIOD!! I was very thankful that the hotel staff always left fresh laundered towels stacked in the Lobby so you never had to worry about dragging your own towels around! Loved the all day, all night free coffee and the fresh fruit in the morning! I was VERY thankful for the guest laundry room which was FREE!! The game room was perfect for the kids to keep busy whenever they got a little bored and for me and my husband to take on a game of pool when we got bored! I'm also thankful for the shower/changing room in the Atrium that allowed us to check out at 11am but still enjoy the pool and be able to shower and change before leaving for good. Oh and lest I forget, there's also an exercise room and tanning bed although I personally didn't utilize them as walking in the sand did my thighs great and I'm already black so tanning is kind of a mute point. (HA!HA!) Oh and there's also wireless internet on the Atrium side and wired Ethernet (high speed) on the oceanfront side where we stayed. The front desk was very accomodating in lending me an ethernet cable for my laptop. And one other thing! There's a safe in the closet in the room which allows you to set your own 4-digit code. I was able to lock up my laptop and all my other valuables while out of the room. This was one heck of a worry free vacation! I will DEFINITELY stay here again! It was worth every penny!!! And now the CONS: Well there aren't many. I wish they cleaned the jacuzzi more than once a day (too many sandy feet), it was quite frankly gross. And the parrots, although beautiful and fun became an noisy annoyance when they woke in the morning but I digress - they were only noisy if you opened your room door. :>) Our first night there we spotted a few micro-sized ant-looking bugs on the kitchen counter. When I informed management they said they would take care of it. When we returned to the room -poof- no bugs for the rest of our week long stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great plac eto stay for reasonable rates”
Reviews.Author: Josie16
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went down to O.C. for a long weekend and heard that it was a nice place to stay and was reasonable. We were not dissapointed. Dan the manager and another worker Donna were very nice and helpful in recommending nice places to eat. The resturant there was very nice as we ate several meals there. My husband and I would definately stay there agian.

Reviews.Title: “NASTY!!!!”
Reviews.Author: jeepgal31
Reviews.Content: I had booked my vacation late so i was limited on hotels and wanted to be right on the beach, so this place was all that was left...unfortunatley.I had a oceanfront front room on the third floor with a private balcony. We opened the door and the smell of mold was overwhelming. I guess the email I sent before I came specifically stating I needed a room with NO mold because my 4 year old daughter is a severe asthmatic didn't get read. There was black mold on the ceiling,along the molding on the top wall,down along the privacy curtain on the wall and the carpet was full of it. Everytime you walked into the bathroom and stepped onto the white bathmat it turned black..GROSS. The "new" renovations consist of haphazard new tiling in the bathroom and holes cut too large for the fixtures so there gaping holes around the ceiling fixtures. Old shower heads,Massive amounts of messy glue around the bottom of the toilet, Old sheets on the beds, Really gross moldy stained carpets,Rusted refrigerator,dishwashers that dont clean, rusty ceiling fan,The most foul smelling hot tubs ever that the color of the water looks like urine, and sand filled indoor pool. Cockroaches around the parrot cages, stained hallway carpets.This place is like an indoor rundown trailer park. It is definetly not worth $1700 for 5 nights. My daughter had to sleep on the balcony because her asthma got so bad, I feel bad for the maid service, they did well trying to make the room look halfway decent each day. The atrium cafe does not do room service for any meal that they deliver to your room. You have to go an pick it UP!!! Stay away from this place and spend a few extra bucks to stay at a place where you will stay healthy.

Reviews.Title: “Yuck...”
Reviews.Author: jimini1012
Reviews.Content: I read some positive & negative reviews of this property and I knew I was taking a chance. My boyfriend and I always stay at Comfort Inn on Boardwalk but since we only had about 2 days to book a hotel, we had to settle for this one. Ugh... We stayed on the first floor by the atrium. The carpets had stains ALL over them, there was a crack on the window in the bathroom AND the nets to keep bugs from coming into the room from outside was partially broken, the sheets on the bed had a pretty big nasty yellowish brown stain on it, the bathroom stank like feet, and the microwave still had some stains and crap inside. We complained, and someone came in and "cleaned" but I still wasn't satisfied. I mean we paid around 300 for this? This hotel had so much potential... I think they could do so much with it but with the price and the quality of the hotel, I would NEVER returned and will advise people to NEVER go there. The only OKAY thing about the hotel was the atrium cafe/bar. The food was better than I expected, the workers there were pretty nice. Happy hour was okay, the mixed frozen drinks weren't great but better than expected.

Reviews.Title: “I would have rather slept in my car”
Reviews.Author: left_at_eaglecap
Reviews.Content: Sleep in your car if you have to, whatever it takes avoid this dump. We stayed two nights and paid about $300 per night for an oceanview room. The "atrium" is nothing more than a imitation housing project sort of set-up with the "guests" hanging their dirty laundry out to dry for you and I to walk by on the way to yet another trailer park dinner. In fact, just go to another city altogether and avoid the "land that time and the dental hygenist forgot" aka Ocean City. The outdoor pool scene was exceptional, if you like looking at very large women who think it is socially accpetable to lounge around the pool in an under-sized wife beater tank top, sans undergarments. Our $300 room reeked of mold, the carpets were damp to the touch. There was rust everywhere that rust could possible take root. Seriously, this was by far the worst hotel (and city) that I have visited in all my travels.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED THE ATRIUM!”
Reviews.Author: squrrel
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at THE QUALITY INN because he remembered having a great time there as a kid. I had never been there but was excited. When we arrived the staff was super attentive and friendly! Our room was very clean and loaded with everything we may neeed to make our stay comfortable! Then the best part was the ATRIUM with the beutiful exotic birds, inside and outside pools {THAT WERE NEVER OVERCROWDED}, inside hot tubs, resturant and beutiful tiki bar! The staff {ESPECIALY THE BAR TENDER} was very friendly and attentive! We had a great time and will definatly be back with our ten year old son, this is a great place to bring kids! WISH IT WASN'T OVER, SPECIAL THANKS TO THE WONDERFUL FRIENDLY STAFF {DONNA RICHARDS} FOR MAKING OUR STAY SO GREAT!

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly Nice”
Reviews.Author: Taleria
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed there for Father's Day weekend. It was a little confusing on how to entire the property, but once we checked in we were very surprised to see what this hotel offered. The scenery was beautiful! The parrots, fish, palm trees were a sight to see. Staff was very nice and helpful. It was nice to see an indoor as well as outdoor pool, sauna and kids play area. Our room was located on the 2nd floor. The room was pretty well kept. A little dated but our balcony overlooked the sands and the beach (which was really nice)! Only disappointment was the tv and furniture could have used a little upgrading especially for what they charged per night. Overall it was a really nice place to stay and I would come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!!!!”
Reviews.Author: HonestLadyTraveler
Reviews.Content: I arrived at the Quality Inn on friday afternoon for a weekend stay with my friends. From the outside the rooms and the hotel look a little bit run down, but the rooms on the inside (we were on the 2nd floor facing the atrium) were really really nice!!! There were double beds, a pull out, and a mini kitchen set up :) We reserved three rooms and all of them were very clean and comfortable. There is a VERY VERY funky smell in room 234 but the other two that we stayed in had no smell AT ALL!!! For the price this is a great place, great location and safe!!! We were only MINUTES from Seacrets and the beach. Would def. stay again, had a fantastic time. The front desk staff was very nice and helpful. I contacted the hotel directly and with AAA discount it was cheaper than expedia or tavelocity!!

Reviews.Title: “I'll give it one more chance this summer of 08”
Reviews.Author: RAYTAMTAY
Reviews.Content: Well my wife and I and two children stayed there last summer in 2007. The room liked nice and the view was great, The only problem we had was when we first walked in the smell hit you like a ton of bricks! I cant explain what kind of smell it was, But I did see a review on here below that someone complained of the same exact thing. So I overlooked it and went out and bought a can of lysol and some candles. It did nothing. I will stay there this year because even though I still think its expensive, compared to the rest of the hotels in the area this is cheap. All the other one's want way over $300 per night which is a joke. So We will give it one more shot this year hopefully there will be no smell. If there is I definetly will complain. I cant explain what it was, it was more of a mildewy smell, maybe it was the beach I dont know. but whatever it was, they need to deodorize their rooms big time.

Reviews.Title: “The BEST choice!!!”
Reviews.Author: a_dallen
Reviews.Content: Me, my fiance and our 1 year old daughter had a great time during our stay at this hotel. We were there for 4 days and 3 nights. We are VERY glad that we chose this hotel to stay at. It was wonderful and well worth the money...and at that, it was inexpensive. They supply all of your needs. They have dishes (pots,pans,silverware,utensils,etc) in each room. The rooms and service were outstanding. Room service didnt bother us upon our request...it was very peaceful and relaxing. The Atrium (an area where they have birds, a bar, pool, hot tubs, and fish) was really nice....Our daughter loved the birds! The bathroom and furnishings in the rooms were well kept and maintained...We are definitely going to stay here again this Summer!

Reviews.Title: “Stay in the Condos !!”
Reviews.Author: tsalladtsallad
Reviews.Content: Every Easter we stay at the nearby Sandpiper Dunes condos owned by the Quality Inn- we get maid service, linens, toiletries, newspapers, fruit, videos etc. just like the hotel guests for a two or three bedroom unit in the tall oceanfront condominium building. By no means a "luxury" property, but comfortable and maintained, with reliable staff to attend to any problems- this year we had a missing shower curtain sent over in ten minutes. Condo renters also have the use of the game room, fitness room, tropical atrium, indoor pool, hot tubs and sauna- again not high-end but adequate. Two and three bedroom condo units tow blocks away can be booked directly from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A "Quality" Inn!! Absolutely Beautiful and Clean Clean Clean!!!”
Reviews.Author: dantheman38
Reviews.Content: We were walk ins off the street (late-night). Here's an 'copied' email the I wrote to the Hotel. It says it all. ATTN MGMNT!!!: Matt - front desk hooked us up!! "Hello.. I just wanted to say that "Matt", whoever this NICE fellow is, "hooked us up" on 3/13 with THE most beautiful room (#509) and we (my girlfriend and I) would like to say thank you. Matt deserves a big "hell yeah!". We needed shelter in the EARLY morning hours of 3/13, he obliged with outstanding room/accommodations, and COMPASSION for road-weary folks that we were with a late check-out as well. I expected the cost to be more, but I KNOW that since it was OFF-season, that is why the room was so reasonable at $43.10 total for our outstanding room. I think Matt gave us the "Penthouse" Suite actually. Funny thing is that I asked for MILD accommodations and he "Hooked Us Up". I was "wowed!!!" by the room upon entering. I was just soo very pleased with our room. He also gave us a late check out as well, which was waaayyy kewl as well. Attached is the "In-room Questionnaire"... filled out for you and my receipt for your viewing so you can see that "MW" was our check-in person. Once again, thank you for your most awesome accommodations, Id love to stay there again, but I saw your IN-season rates and can not afford those rates for that room (#509) during In-season. but... Its was awesome to sleep in a "Penthouse" for JUST one night. Please DO POST this email around your hotel for viewing by walk-in customers that wander in during the late night/early morning hours. please?.. thank you. thanks again... many regards, Daniel Johnson and Karen Branam" that pretty much says it all from my standpoint and Id HIGHLY recommend this place for families. see photos.

Reviews.Title: “the worst experience ever”
Reviews.Author: travis1Pasadena
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very dirty, mold all around the tub floor. Allowing people to SMOKE in their rooms. Will never stay or recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “This was the worst hotel ever!!”
Reviews.Author: qutypie15
Reviews.Content: This was the worst hotel I have ever stayed in. The doors would not open at first, you would have to slide your key card a million times before the doors would open. The rooms on the third floor were extremely dirty. There were stains all over the carpets, and the rooms needed to be vacuumed. The atrium, where they house all the birds, is dirty and worn down. The birds are out during the night, and they screech constantly! They never stop. And you can hear them in your rooms. The balcony doors don't open unless you put all of your body weight against them.......good luck girls!! There was mold on the ceilings in all the rooms I saw. The cooking areas in the third floor rooms was disgusting!! It was dirty and uncleaned. I wouldn't have cooked on that stove or ate anything from that area, it was revolting. The bathroom was dirty as well. There was a black line that went completely around the bathtub. I wouldn't have touched the shower curtain for anything in the world. This was the worst hotel ever. It doesn't even compare to the hostels that I have stayed in. DON'T STAY HERE!!!

Reviews.Title: “Stay away!”
Reviews.Author: mmcgla1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Quality Inn on 54th street for 2 nights for New Years. I have to say that it is the most disgusting place I have ever stayed. Our room was on the 3rd floor that over looked the Atrium. When we first checked in, it was so hot, we had to leave the balcony door and front door open to cool it off because the AC was turned off for the winter. The carpet was mildewed and stained; I wore socks because I refused to let my foot touch the floor. Also, the bathroom was covered with mold and black stuff in the shower. All the caulking was cracking and coming off. The ceiling was also cracking and stained. Our friends stayed a few doors down and their room was just as run down. They had a full size refrigerator that was covered with rust on the side of it. The second day, more friends came down, and they had a newly renovated room on the second floor, which I have to say, was in excellent condition. It was clean, and completely remodeled. We had paid the same price as our friends in the newly renovated room, and our room was a complete dump. So I complained to the front desk, and of course was told that there was nothing that could be done. They were not rude about it; they just said that they were booked because of the holiday weekend. But after seeing a 100 % Satisfaction Guarantee sign in our friend’s room, I went back to the front desk, with the sign, and miraculously, a newly renovated room became available on the 2nd. So I have to say the newly renovated room was very nice, but the Quality Inn should be ashamed to even rent out the old rooms. To expect someone to pay a lot of money to stay in a room with rust, mold, stains, and mildew, is completely unprofessional. Had I known they had newly renovated rooms, I would have complained the first night. Also, I understand that people may go to that Quality Inn to see the birds in the Atrium (I am not one of them), but just to warn you, they do start squawking around 9:00 a.m. Which can become quite annoying.

Reviews.Title: “A dump that you can not relax in”
Reviews.Author: jpdeadhead
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Quality Inn in Ocean City, Maryland on 54th street. Apparently this hotel is more accomodating for some tropical birds than the people staying there. My first room was dirty and smelled so bad from garlic that I could not stay there. In our second room, everything was covered in rust, the couch was broken, and we were given a cable because the advertised wireless internet access was a lie and didn't reach beyond the attrium. We were told to use our laptops in the atrium. The atrium is about 80 degrees with 100 humidity. I didn't want to sit in the atrim let alone have my laptop there. The humidity is so bad in the hotel I could not style my hair properly. The worst part of our stay was the screaming, screeching birds at 9:00am in the morning. At checkout, I was not asked about my stay and when I complained I was told that 1) the hotel has to be humid for the birds 2) people love those birds and come to the hotel just for them. This hotel is a dump for over $100 a night off season in December

Reviews.Title: “Another Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: Stat-Boy-8
Reviews.Content: Our family has been staying at this hotel in the Fall for probably 8 out of the last 10 years. We have never had a problem. As always, the room was clean, the front desk people were very helpful and accommodating, and the remaining hotel staff were all friendly. We actually met other guests who come here this time every year. There has been discussion on other reviews regarding the birds. Yes, the 14 asst'd Conures, Macaws and Cockatoos can get quite noisy at times. Their cages get uncovered around 9:00 am. If that's not to your liking, you should probably go elsewhere. Personally, I'd rather hear the birds than kids squealing and screaming in the pool. The birds are fed and cared for each morning. I learned that most were adoptions/rescues. They are fun to be around. Overall, the Hotel common areas were clean. You need to note that if you book a room that is Atrium View, (not Oceanfront) and not on the 1st floor (of 3), you will have to go outside, then back inside, to get to the indoor pool/hot tub. Not the best thing when temperatures are in the 40's. While we enjoy our off-season stay, I doubt that we'd stay here, or any hotel/motel in Ocean City, in Prime Season. Simply too crowded for me. Overall, this place is an excellent off-season value.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: bummer0531
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very outdated. The beach outside the hotel balcony covered in litter. The door area where the lock was, was busted and instead of fixing the piece of wood and putting on another lock, they just moved the lock and left the busted door jam. Atrium is not as it appears online. Very dirty and worn. The pool was dirty and full of sand. They have a sign in the bathroom saying that you may experience a difference in temp in the shower and that it is due to OC's fluctuation in water pressure. The shower went from cold to scalding hot the entire time anyone was in the shower. We stayed one night then left and found another hotel. The new hotel said they never heard of the water problem and we had no trouble taking a shower there. This hotel is not worth the money. Don't book it and be sorry like we did.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced, poor management, DO NOT STAY”
Reviews.Author: Desi_traveler_77
Reviews.Content: We decided to take a weekend get away to Ocean City and in looking for hotels we came across the Quality Inn Ocean front. Everyone had told us to stay in northern OC beacause it was a better area with nice hotels. In speaking with the Quality Inn staff the room rate for the weekend started at $300 a night and after much negotiation i got the price to $199 for each night Fri/Sat. On arrival at the hotel, the first thing we notice is at least 20 Parrots in the "Artium". Squaking and screaming like it was a bird sanctuary. Our room was on the 4th floor over looking the ocean. Once we got to our room, it was not even clean. We were told they were remodeled rooms. There were urine stains on the toilet, dried up food on the coutertop, and stains on the tables. That night, it was about 90 degrees outside, and awe turned the A/C on to 65 degrees. My 12mo daughter was up the whole night because the room never cooled down. The A/C was blowing warm air all night. By the time we woke up in the morning our sheets were drenched. When i spoke to the management they told me the A/C controls are reversed and i was supposed to set the temp to 85 degress to cool it down. The following day the A/C broke again. This time the sensor for the door stopped working so the A/C would not turn on because the sensor indicated the balcony door was open and it does not work if the door is open. We called the desk and they sent a maintenece guy up at 10pm. He did not not know what to do, so for an hour he went in and out of the room accomplishing nothing. Finially i fixed it by playing with the sensor. In addition to the A/C, the cleaning staff was extremely rude. After telling the management about the A/C problems we had and the poor condition with which the room was cleaned when we arrived, the desk assured us we would get VIP cleaning that morning. After the room was cleaned we returned to our room only to find trash not taken out, NO towels, more food stains not cleaned, and some trash just pushed under the furniture. The only good thing about this hotel is the view.......the hotel itself is disgusting. After spending nearly $400 over a weekend i feel like i was truly ripped off.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely NOT a Family Resort”
Reviews.Author: southjerseymom
Reviews.Content: Took a quick 2 night trip last week to OC for some crabs on Father's Day. (Try PGN at 29th for the best crabs ever!!!). Read some so so reviews about the hotel and asked the family to stay in the car why I checked it out. First impression bad...trash all over sidewalk. Pool in back of hotel in parking lot. Windows leading to lobby were so dirty you couldn't see through them. We had booked atrium view because we live on the beach and don't really care about view. We were told room had view of atrium area with tropical wonderland of indoor pool and garden. Yech! Filthy indoor pool, bird cages full of poop. No way was I letting my kids in that pool. I knew I was in trouble. Asked to look at room. Steps up back of building rotted out. Room ok but looked out over discusting indoor pool and smelly birds. Asked to see oceanview. Room worse. Even hubby who hates that I am pickey about rooms said the place was a dump. At $179/night plus 11% tax we wanted out. Front Desk returned money when I politely complained that I just could not stay there. Definitely a senior week crash pad instead of the family "resort" advertised.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: cjajsmom
Reviews.Content: We stayed from April 22 through April 25. Our oceanfront room was beyond our expectations after reading other reviews. The bed was extremely comfortable. The room was clean and well-kept. The view was excellent. The parrots were fine in spite of the complaints of another reviewer. Their cages were cleaned daily (I only clean my parrots' cages weekly), they had new toys, they were covered nightly. Some were allowed to be out of their cages. Their wings were trimmed. As parrots go, I think these guys were happy and definitely seemed to enjoy the human interaction. The pool was clean. I was told by someone else that the hot tub was too hot, but I didn't try it. Fruit in the lobby was very fresh and abundant. The coffee area was clean and well-stocked. Coffee was always available. Most of the staff were very nice. There appear to be a number of play areas inside and outside. This is nice for families with younger children. The ground floor ocean front rooms walk out to a protected sandy area. A nice plus for families. We were given a great room rate after I asked for the rock bottom price. If you are used to a luxury hotel, then you won't be happy here. But if you are looking for sufficient accomodations, this hotel will be satisfactory. But -- there always has to be a "but" right? Our refrigerator clunked like a soda machine delivering your can every time the compressor went off. Try sleeping through that! We reported it Monday morning. Nothing was done. After two more nights of clunk-clunk-clunk, we checked out a day early. We were not charged for one night, so only paid for two of our three nights. The light on the nightstand sizzled and popped when my husband switched it on. We reported this also on Monday, considering it to be a fire hazard. Nothing was done about this either. No hot water was available our third (and final) morning. Front desk was inundated with calls about this while we were checking out. You could tell they were getting frazzled. Ice machines are only available on the second and fourth floors. I think they should have been available on every floor. We did not receive room service our second day. I guess the two hours we were in the room between 8:00 and 5:30 did not leave enough free hours for them to clean the room? We found a bag of clean towels hanging on our door handle. Would we go back? Yes, but with family in the area, I doubt we'll need a hotel room too often. But if we do, we would probably choose to stay here again.
